roleset.name: (cause to) stick out
roleset.note: PROJECT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'project' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 47.6, other framed members include hover, lie, sit and stand. No Framenet entry. No comparison. (from project.01-v predicate notes)
PROJECTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry project.01. Maps to Verbnet entry 47.6. Framed by Claire. (from projection.01-n)

example.name: agentive
example.text: John projected an enormous shadow onto the wall.

example.name: ergative
example.text: John's enormous shadow projected onto the wall.

example.name: All arguments, metaphorical projection
example.text: Knotts is Knotts' own worst enemy despite his frequent projection of the blame onto ?bloggers? and other perceived ?enemies.?

roleset.name: tell the future
roleset.note: PROJECT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'project' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet entry 47.6, other framed members include hover, lie, sit and stand. No Framenet entry. No comparison. (from project.02-v predicate notes)
PROJECTION-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry project.02. Maps to VN class estimate-34.2. (from projection.02-n)

role.descr: attribute, arg1 predicted to have what characteristic?

example.name: normal usage
example.text: Analysts had been projecting fully diluted earnings in the third quarter in the range of about $1.30 a share.
example.arg: fully diluted earnings in the third quarter in the range of about $1.30 a share

example.name: stupid passive extraction, use arg 2 for predicted to be
example.text: On top of that, Boeing would make cost-of-living adjustments projected to be 5% for each year of the contract.
example.arg: to be 5 % for each year of the contract

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: In Rahway , N.J. , a Merck spokesman said the company does n't make earnings projections .

example.name: stupid passive extraction
example.text: Officials should meet their earnings projection of $1.20 per share next year.
